did.abstract: This collection predmoinantly contains the Death Penalty Information Center's audio/video resources on capital punishment.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

scopecontent.head: Description of Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains handwritten notes, some news clips, audio cassettes, and over 200 video cassettes. The cassettes contain media coverage related to capital punishment, including documentaries about the death penalty; news about executions, clemency, victims, innocence, race, mental health, Death Row interviews, and more.

acqinfo.p: All items in this collection were transferred to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives by Anne Holsinger in 2017.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Founded in 1990 and based in Washington, D.C., the Death Penalty Information Center is a national non-profit organization serving the media and public with analysis and information on issues concerning capital punishment. In addition to the day-to-day resources it provides, the Center releases an annual report on the death penalty, highlighting significant developments and featuring the latest statistics.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
